title: iOS Software Engineer 1 (Garmin Golf)
full_description: We're looking for a full-time iOS Software Engineer 1 to join the Garmin Golf Apps team at our headquarters in Olathe, KS. As a member of our team, you'll participate in the development of Garmin applications using modern software development practices, coding standards, and release processes.Responsibilities include:Writing, testing, and debugging Swift codeUsing tools such as Xcode, Git, Bitbucket, and Jira in the software development processArchitecting and implementing designs for software components within a larger projectParticipating in peer code reviewsProviding reliable solutions to a variety of problems using sound problem solving techniquesEstimating level of effort, evaluating new options of similar technology, and offering suggestions to improve processesCollaborating with internal and external stakeholders around the world Qualified candidates will possess a Bachelor of Science Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, or another relevant engineering/technical field from a four-year college or university OR an equivalent combination of education and relevant experience with a 3.0 cumulative GPA or higher.Other qualifications include:Demonstrated experience designing, writing, testing, and debugging object-oriented and/or protocol-oriented code in SwiftProficiency with Apple iOS SDK frameworks such as Foundation, UIKit, and Core DataProficiency interacting with RESTful APIs using JSONExperience integrating and maintaining third-party software packagesDemonstrated ability to thrive in a collaborative environment and prioritize work for multiple simultaneous projectsPreferred qualifications include:Interest in and familiarity with golfExperience with computer graphics development platforms such as UnityFamiliarity with CI/CD tools and the app deployment process Garmin International is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran's status, age or disability.
